hackathon-description-text: Hack SMC an opportunity to create solutions to help improve our communities throughout San Mateo County.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: President, San Mateo County Board of Supervisors
OpenSMC Brigade Captain, Planner, City of Redwood City
Communications Specialist, Health System, San Mateo County
Co-founder and Director, Strategic Accounts, OpenGov
Assistant Agency Director, Human Services Agency, San Mateo County
Developer Support Analyst - ArcGIS SDK Team, Esri
Director, Office of Sustainability, San Mateo County

hackathon-rules: We expect all Hack SMC related events:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: In addition to the cash prize of $1,500, winning teams will have the chance to compete in the Apps Challenge in September, 2016.
Teams that win the honorable mention prizes will receive $250 and bragging rights.
The teams that use Kinetise to develop their app will be eligible to win Kinetise App Publishing licenses. Each license is worth $1,186. Find out more about Kinetise at

The teams that use Esri's technology to develop their app will be eligible to win Esri's mapping technology (ArcGIS.com, ArcGIS API for JavaScript, Runtime SDKs, or apps) will win a $1,000 prize. This prize is judged by Esri staff and awarded by the County.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=425 Broadway St, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Use a dataset from the County's open data portal: 
, from the County's maps and spatial data portal: 
 or create a dataset
The solution is original or approaches the stated problem in a new way
The technology used to create the solution is logical, workable, and maintainable.

The solution meets a stated challenge on the Hack SMC site: 
 or is of value to the public and the County

Opt-in prizes require solution to utilize one or more of the following platforms: ArcGIS.com or APIs (Esri), Kinetise, or Wolfram Alpha. Participants must opt-in to these prizes when submitting their team information.

hackathon-location-address: 425 Broadway St, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create solutions that help improve the lives people who live and work in San Mateo County
